00075 typedef struct TransSnap {
00076     short   mode;
00077     short   target;
00078     short   modePoint;
00079     short   modeSelect;
00080     short   align;

00082     char    snap_self;

00084     short   status;
00085     float   snapPoint[3]; /* snapping from this point */
00086     float   snapTarget[3]; /* to this point */
00087     float   snapNormal[3];
00088     float   snapTangent[3];

00090     TransSnapPoint  *selectedPoint;
00091     float   dist; // Distance from snapPoint to snapTarget
00092     double  last;
00093     void  (*applySnap)(struct TransInfo *, float *);
00094     void  (*calcSnap)(struct TransInfo *, float *);
00095     void  (*targetSnap)(struct TransInfo *);
00096     float  (*distance)(struct TransInfo *, float p1[3], float p2[3]); // Get the transform distance between two points (used by Closest snap)
00097 } TransSnap;

00099 typedef struct TransCon {
00100     short orientation;   
00101     char  text[50];      /* Description of the Constraint for header_print                            */
00102     float mtx[3][3];     /* Matrix of the Constraint space                                            */
00103     float imtx[3][3];    /* Inverse Matrix of the Constraint space                                    */
00104     float pmtx[3][3];    /* Projection Constraint Matrix (same as imtx with some axis == 0)           */
00105     float center[3];     /* transformation center to define where to draw the view widget
00106                           * ALWAYS in global space. Unlike the transformation center                  */
00107     int   imval[2];      /* initial mouse value for visual calculation                                */
00108                          /* the one in TransInfo is not garanty to stay the same (Rotates change it)  */
00109     int   mode;          /* Mode flags of the Constraint                                              */
00110     void  (*drawExtra)(struct TransInfo *);
00111                          /* For constraints that needs to draw differently from the other
00112                           * uses this instead of the generic draw function                            */
00113     void  (*applyVec)(struct TransInfo *, struct TransData *, float *, float *, float *);
00114                          /* Apply function pointer for linear vectorial transformation                */
00115                          /* The last three parameters are pointers to the in/out/printable vectors    */
00116     void  (*applySize)(struct TransInfo *, struct TransData *, float [3][3]);
00117                          /* Apply function pointer for size transformation */
00118     void  (*applyRot)(struct TransInfo *, struct TransData *, float [3], float *);
00119                          /* Apply function pointer for rotation transformation */
00120 } TransCon;

00122 typedef struct TransDataExtension {
00123     float drot[3];       /* Initial object drot */
00124     // float drotAngle;  /* Initial object drotAngle,    TODO: not yet implemented */
00125     // float drotAxis[3];    /* Initial object drotAxis, TODO: not yet implemented */
00126     float dquat[4];      /* Initial object dquat */
00127     float dscale[3];     /* Initial object dscale */
00128     float *rot;          /* Rotation of the data to transform (Faculative)                                 */
00129     float  irot[3];      /* Initial rotation                                                               */
00130     float *quat;         /* Rotation quaternion of the data to transform (Faculative)                      */
00131     float  iquat[4];     /* Initial rotation quaternion                                                    */
00132     float *rotAngle;     /* Rotation angle of the data to transform (Faculative)                           */
00133     float  irotAngle;    /* Initial rotation angle                                                         */
00134     float *rotAxis;      /* Rotation axis of the data to transform (Faculative)                            */
00135     float  irotAxis[4];  /* Initial rotation axis                                                          */
00136     float *size;         /* Size of the data to transform (Faculative)                                     */
00137     float  isize[3];     /* Initial size                                                                   */
00138     float  obmat[4][4];  /* Object matrix */
00139     float  l_smtx[3][3]; /* use instead of td->smtx, It is the same but without the 'bone->bone_mat', see TD_PBONE_LOCAL_MTX_C */
00140     int    rotOrder;    /* rotation mode,  as defined in eRotationModes (DNA_action_types.h) */
00141 } TransDataExtension;

00158 typedef struct TransDataSeq {
00159     struct Sequence *seq;
00160     int flag;       /* a copy of seq->flag that may be modified for nested strips */
00161     int start_offset; /* use this so we can have transform data at the strips start, but apply correctly to the start frame  */

00164 } TransDataSeq;

00166 /* for NLA transform (stored in td->extra pointer) */
00167 typedef struct TransDataNla {
00168     ID *id;                     /* ID-block NLA-data is attached to */
00169     
00170     struct NlaTrack *oldTrack;  /* Original NLA-Track that the strip belongs to */
00171     struct NlaTrack *nlt;       /* Current NLA-Track that the strip belongs to */
00172     
00173     struct NlaStrip *strip;     /* NLA-strip this data represents */
00174     
00175     /* dummy values for transform to write in - must have 3 elements... */
00176     float h1[3];                /* start handle */
00177     float h2[3];                /* end handle */
00178     
00179     int trackIndex;             /* index of track that strip is currently in */
00180     int handle;                 /* handle-index: 0 for dummy entry, -1 for start, 1 for end, 2 for both ends */
00181 } TransDataNla;

00210 typedef struct TransData {
00211     float  dist;         /* Distance needed to affect element (for Proportionnal Editing)                  */
00212     float  rdist;        /* Distance to the nearest element (for Proportionnal Editing)                    */
00213     float  factor;       /* Factor of the transformation (for Proportionnal Editing)                       */
00214     float *loc;          /* Location of the data to transform                                              */
00215     float  iloc[3];      /* Initial location                                                               */
00216     float *val;          /* Value pointer for special transforms */
00217     float  ival;         /* Old value*/
00218     float  center[3];    /* Individual data center                                                         */
00219     float  mtx[3][3];    /* Transformation matrix from data space to global space                          */
00220     float  smtx[3][3];   /* Transformation matrix from global space to data space                          */
00221     float  axismtx[3][3];/* Axis orientation matrix of the data                                            */
00222     struct Object *ob;
00223     struct bConstraint *con;    /* for objects/bones, the first constraint in its constraint stack */
00224     TransDataExtension *ext;    /* for objects, poses. 1 single malloc per TransInfo! */
00225     TransDataCurveHandleFlags *hdata; /* for curves, stores handle flags for modification/cancel */
00226     void  *extra;        /* extra data (mirrored element pointer, in editmode mesh to BMVert) (editbone for roll fixing) (...) */
00227     int  flag;           /* Various flags */
00228     short  protectflag;  /* If set, copy of Object or PoseChannel protection */
00229 } TransData;

00243 typedef struct TransInfo {
00244     int         mode;           /* current mode                         */
00245     int         flag;           /* generic flags for special behaviors  */
00246     int         modifiers;      /* special modifiers, by function, not key */
00247     short       state;          /* current state (running, canceled,...)*/
00248     int         options;        /* current context/options for transform                      */
00249     float       val;            /* init value for some transformations (and rotation angle)  */
00250     float       fac;            /* factor for distance based transform  */
00251     int       (*transform)(struct TransInfo *, const int *);
00252                                 /* transform function pointer           */
00253     int       (*handleEvent)(struct TransInfo *, struct wmEvent *);
00254                                 /* event handler function pointer  RETURN 1 if redraw is needed */
00255     int         total;          /* total number of transformed data     */
00256     TransData  *data;           /* transformed data (array)             */
00257     TransDataExtension *ext;    /* transformed data extension (array)   */
00258     TransData2D *data2d;        /* transformed data for 2d (array)      */
00259     TransCon    con;            /* transformed constraint               */
00260     TransSnap   tsnap;
00261     NumInput    num;            /* numerical input                      */
00262     MouseInput  mouse;          /* mouse input                          */
00263     char        redraw;         /* redraw flag                          */
00264     float       prop_size;      /* proportional circle radius           */
00265     char        proptext[20];   /* proportional falloff text            */
00266     float       center[3];      /* center of transformation             */
00267     int         center2d[2];    /* center in screen coordinates         */
00268     int         imval[2];       /* initial mouse position               */
00269     short       event_type;     /* event->type used to invoke transform */
00270     short       idx_max;        /* maximum index on the input vector    */
00271     float       snap[3];        /* Snapping Gears                       */
00272     char        frame_side;     /* Mouse side of the cfra, 'L', 'R' or 'B' */
00273 
00274     float       viewmat[4][4];  /* copy from G.vd, prevents feedback,   */
00275     float       viewinv[4][4];  /* and to make sure we don't have to    */
00276     float       persmat[4][4];  /* access G.vd from other space types   */
00277     float       persinv[4][4];
00278     short       persp;
00279     short       around;
00280     char        spacetype;      /* spacetype where transforming is      */
00281     char        helpline;       /* helpline modes (not to be confused with hotline) */
00282 
00283     float       vec[3];         /* translation, to show for widget      */
00284     float       mat[3][3];      /* rot/rescale, to show for widget      */
00285 
00286     char        *undostr;       /* if set, uses this string for undo        */
00287     float       spacemtx[3][3]; /* orientation matrix of the current space  */
00288     char        spacename[64];  /* name of the current space, MAX_NAME      */
00289 
00290     struct Object *poseobj;     /* if t->flag & T_POSE, this denotes pose object */
00291 
00292     void       *customData;     /* Per Transform custom data */
00293     void      (*customFree)(struct TransInfo *); /* if a special free function is needed */
00294 
00295     /*************** NEW STUFF *********************/
00296     short       launch_event;   /* event type used to launch transform */
00297 
00298     short       current_orientation;
00299     short       twtype;         /* backup from view3d, to restore on end */
00300 
00301     short       prop_mode;
00302     
00303     short       mirror;
00304 
00305     float       values[4];
00306     float       auto_values[4];
00307     float       axis[3];
00308     float       axis_orig[3];   /* TransCon can change 'axis', store the original value here */
00309 
00310     void        *view;
00311     struct bContext *context; /* Only valid (non null) during an operator called function. */
00312     struct ScrArea  *sa;
00313     struct ARegion  *ar;

00328 /* transinfo->state */
00329 #define TRANS_STARTING  0
00330 #define TRANS_RUNNING   1
00331 #define TRANS_CONFIRM   2
00332 #define TRANS_CANCEL    3
00333 
00334 /* transinfo->redraw */
00335 #define TREDRAW_NOTHING     0
00336 #define TREDRAW_HARD        1
00337 #define TREDRAW_SOFT        2

00339 
00340 /* transinfo->flag */
00341 #define T_OBJECT        (1 << 0)
00342 #define T_EDIT          (1 << 1)
00343 #define T_POSE          (1 << 2)
00344 #define T_TEXTURE       (1 << 3)
00345 #define T_CAMERA        (1 << 4)
00346          // trans on points, having no rotation/scale
00347 #define T_POINTS        (1 << 6)
00348         // for manipulator exceptions, like scaling using center point, drawing help lines
00349 #define T_USES_MANIPULATOR  (1 << 7)
00350 
00351     /* restrictions flags */
00352 #define T_ALL_RESTRICTIONS  ((1 << 8)|(1 << 9)|(1 << 10))
00353 #define T_NO_CONSTRAINT     (1 << 8)
00354 #define T_NULL_ONE          (1 << 9)
00355 #define T_NO_ZERO           (1 << 10)
00356 
00357 #define T_PROP_EDIT         (1 << 11)
00358 #define T_PROP_CONNECTED    (1 << 12)
00359 
00360 #define T_V3D_ALIGN         (1 << 14)
00361     /* for 2d views like uv or ipo */
00362 #define T_2D_EDIT           (1 << 15)
00363 #define T_CLIP_UV           (1 << 16)
00364 
00365 #define T_FREE_CUSTOMDATA   (1 << 17)
00366     /* auto-ik is on */
00367 #define T_AUTOIK            (1 << 18)
00368 
00369 #define T_MIRROR            (1 << 19)
00370 
00371 #define T_AUTOVALUES        (1 << 20)
00372 
00373     /* to specificy if we save back settings at the end */
00374 #define T_MODAL             (1 << 21)
00375 
00376     /* no retopo */
00377 #define T_NO_PROJECT        (1 << 22)
00378 
00379 #define T_RELEASE_CONFIRM   (1 << 23)
00380 
00381     /* alternative transformation. used to add offset to tracking markers */
00382 #define T_ALT_TRANSFORM     (1 << 24)
00383 
00384 /* TransInfo->modifiers */
00385 #define MOD_CONSTRAINT_SELECT   0x01
00386 #define MOD_PRECISION           0x02
00387 #define MOD_SNAP                0x04
00388 #define MOD_SNAP_INVERT         0x08
00389 #define MOD_CONSTRAINT_PLANE    0x10
00390

00394 /* transinfo->helpline */
00395 #define HLP_NONE        0
00396 #define HLP_SPRING      1
00397 #define HLP_ANGLE       2
00398 #define HLP_HARROW      3
00399 #define HLP_VARROW      4
00400 #define HLP_TRACKBALL   5
00401 
00402 /* transinfo->con->mode */
00403 #define CON_APPLY       1
00404 #define CON_AXIS0       2
00405 #define CON_AXIS1       4
00406 #define CON_AXIS2       8
00407 #define CON_SELECT      16
00408 #define CON_NOFLIP      32  /* does not reorient vector to face viewport when on */
00409 #define CON_USER        64
00410 
00411 /* transdata->flag */
00412 #define TD_SELECTED         1
00413 #define TD_ACTIVE           (1 << 1)
00414 #define TD_NOACTION         (1 << 2)
00415 #define TD_USEQUAT          (1 << 3)
00416 #define TD_NOTCONNECTED     (1 << 4)
00417 #define TD_SINGLESIZE       (1 << 5)    /* used for scaling of MetaElem->rad */
00418 /*#define TD_TIMEONLY           (1 << 8) */ /*UNUSED*/
00419 #define TD_NOCENTER         (1 << 9)
00420 #define TD_NO_EXT           (1 << 10)   /* ext abused for particle key timing */
00421 #define TD_SKIP             (1 << 11)   /* don't transform this data */
00422 #define TD_BEZTRIPLE        (1 << 12)   /* if this is a bez triple, we need to restore the handles, if this is set transdata->misc.hdata needs freeing */
00423 #define TD_NO_LOC           (1 << 13)   /* when this is set, don't apply translation changes to this element */
00424 #define TD_NOTIMESNAP       (1 << 14)   /* for Graph Editor autosnap, indicates that point should not undergo autosnapping */
00425 #define TD_INTVALUES        (1 << 15)   /* for Graph Editor - curves that can only have int-values need their keyframes tagged with this */
00426 #define TD_MIRROR_EDGE      (1 << 16)   /* For editmode mirror, clamp to x = 0 */
00427 #define TD_MOVEHANDLE1      (1 << 17)   /* For fcurve handles, move them along with their keyframes */
00428 #define TD_MOVEHANDLE2      (1 << 18)
00429 #define TD_PBONE_LOCAL_MTX_P (1 << 19)  /* exceptional case with pose bone rotating when a parent bone has 'Local Location' option enabled and rotating also transforms it. */
00430 #define TD_PBONE_LOCAL_MTX_C (1 << 20)  /* same as above but for a child bone */
00431 
00432 /* transsnap->status */
00433 #define SNAP_FORCED     1
00434 #define TARGET_INIT     2
00435 #define POINT_INIT      4
00436 #define MULTI_POINTS    8
